subject: Appearance of Officers of NHAI before Ld. Arbitral Tribunals in terms of Affidavit filed by them on the advice of Advocates/Law Firms of NHAI
text: HRav <zv <TTHTf xifetdrut &H19 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (&ea 4ar- 3t AAT4) W47 Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vft-5 & 6, Hazr-10 , ERaT, T ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/SoP on Contractual Disputes/2020 Policy Circular No- 2.1.34/2020 Dated 31st January, 2020 [Decision taken on File no. 11011/5/2007-Vallarpadam (Arb.) of Kerala Division, NHAI, HQ] Sub: Appearance of Officers of NHAI before Ld: Arbitral Tribunals in terms of the Affidavits filed by them on the advice of Advocates/Law Firms of NHAI: It has come to the notice that the officer of NHAI, who filed the Affidavit on behalf of NHAI before Ld. Arbitral Tribunal (AT) did not appear before Ld. AT for testimony of the Affidavit despite the advice of Advocate of NHAI on the pretext that he was transferred and joined a new PIU. Such instances may weaken the case of NHAI and lead to adverse orders against NHAI: 2_ Henceforth, the presenting officer of NHAI, who filed the Affidavit on behalf of NHAI before Ld. Arbitral Tribunal (AT), even if he is transferred to another PIU, shall attend the hearings before Ld. Arbitral Tribunal, as and when called for testimony of his Affidavit. 3 This issues with the approval of Chairman. 31  9 | (V.K. Sharma) CGM (Coord &Parl.)
